# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory
files = []
import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        files.append(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.3144a175: studpd['Social Support'] = studpd['Social Support'].apply(lambda x : x * 10)
source.a72bbd1c: studpd['Healthy Life Expectancy'] = studpd['Healthy Life Expectancy'].apply(lambda x : x / 10)
source.3916c6aa: studpd['Freedom to Make Life Choices'] = studpd['Freedom to Make Life Choices'].apply(lambda x : x * 10)
source.f730b5ee: studpd['Perceptions of Corruption'] = studpd['Perceptions of Corruption'].apply(lambda x : x * 10)
source.6ed7102a: studpd['to_live'] = (studpd['Happiness Scores'] * weights[0] + studpd['Social Support'] * weights[1] + studpd['Healthy Life Expectancy'] * weights[2] + studpd['Freedom to Make Life Choices'] * weights[3] + studpd['Generosity'] * weights[4] - studpd['Perceptions of Corruption'] * weights[5])/ sum(weights)
source.87997295: # Top most countries with higher happiness scores
source.e727333a:
# Weight for each Features
                                Ranges     Weights
* Happiness Scores              1 - 10      9
* Social Support                0.1 - 1     8
* Healthy Life Expectancy       0 - 100     9
* Freedom to Make Life Choices  0.1 - 1     9
* Generocity                    -0.9 - 0.9  8
* Perceptions of Corruption     0.1 - 0.9   3
